DataElement.preferredName: Person Asymptomatic Breast Disease And Breast Cancer Screening Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine clinical trial eligibility for questions related to breast disease and the early detection of breast cancer as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Asymptomatic Breast Disorder and Breast Cancer Screening Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Having no signs or symptoms of disease._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Early detection of breast cancer involving asymptomatic women. Generally done in the population with higher risk, due to environmental or genetic factors._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Asymptomatic Breast Disorder And Breast Cancer Screening Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Having no signs or symptoms of disease.:A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Early detection of breast cancer involving asymptomatic women. Generally done in the population with higher risk, due to environmental or genetic factors.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Without clinical signs or indications that raise the possibility of a particular disorder or dysfunction.

A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Early detection of breast cancer involving asymptomatic women. Generally done in the population with higher risk, due to environmental or genetic factors.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
